title: Unstable fingerprint after incremental recompilation

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Recompiling (incrementally) openethereum after some modifications results in the error below:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Found unstable fingerprints for hir_module_items(ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions): ModuleItems { submodules: [DefId(0:18987 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::contract_version), DefId(0:19004 ~ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::contract_name_hash), DefId(0:19022 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::contract_name), DefId(0:19039 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::allowed_tx_types)], items: [ItemId { def_id: DefId(0:18984 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::{misc#0}) }, ItemId { def_id: DefId(0:18987 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::contract_version) }, ItemId { def_id: DefId(0:19004 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::contract_name_hash) }, ItemId { def_id: DefId(0:19022 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::contract_name) }, ItemId { def_id: DefId(0:19039 ~ ethcore[cfff]::tx_filter::transact_acl::functions::allowed_tx_types) }], trait_items: [], impl_items: [], foreign_items: [] }', compiler/rustc_query_system/src/query/plumbing.rs:675:9
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
```

rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C debug-assertions=on -C incremental

query stack during panic:
```
#0 [hir_module_items] HIR module items in `tx_filter::transact_acl::functions`
#1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
```

## Steps to reproduce
```bash
git clone https://github.com/openethereum/openethereum.git
cd openethereum/crates/ethcore
cargo build
# edit some files
cargo build # fails
```
